comment: Easy A class. Learn the material for the exam. Really easy class.
Dr. Sekar, class was fun as she teaches the class with passion and she enjoys answering questions. Overall good experience.
Dr.Sekar I a great professor who clearly explains topics and helps her students suceed. She uses good slides and teaches with passion!

Great professor. Clearly explained materials and had no problem reexplaning if you were struggling. Gave plenty of extra credit opportunities and quizzes are open notes. Easy A with a little effort. Only downside was some of the wording on quizzes, exams, and rubrics could be a little unclear.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Terrible professor, not good at teaching. Exams were difficult and what she wanted on the assignments were not clear. Poor and rough grader.....

She's not a bad instructor but the course is not very interesting or engaging. The work is tedious and monotonous. 10 quizzes and 3 tests (in class but open book). The semester long group project will be the most time consuming part of the class but very little guidance is given to the coding/technical aspect of it. Start early if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Enjoyed the class. Professor was straight forward which I like.
Great professor, took her for an online summer course and she was great, quick responses with feedback and super caring professor. She will make sure you succeed if you show her you're trying to!

Overall good professor, took her over the summer, and was not hard. Does not have video lectures which can be an issue sometimes, but very responsive to emails and will give you feedback on assignments before they are due. Tests are not bad, going over the slides right before the exams will help a lot with oddball questions. Solid for an 8-week.

She took the time to make instructor notes of her own which were much easier to understand than textbook and is very accessible outside of class. Her handwriting and accent are kind of difficult to understand/read, but she's still a good instructor. Semester-long group project, fair grader, and gives a lot of resources. Textbook was free online.

CS 3153 (Database Systems) is a dull and difficult class but Professor Sekar worked very hard to make it understandable for her students. She was prompt at addressing issues that arose. I can't recommend the course but I can recommend the Professor; she is a dedicated, well-organized teacher who does whatever she can to help her students learn.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: This class was surprisingly easy with professor Sekar; her first language isn't English so most assignments have small errors that make them sometimes difficult to understand. If you don't know if you're doing an assignment correctly, EMAIL HER!!! She will answer back with help each time. Two parts to each test, 1st lockdown and 2nd making a table
